toys.name: Sensory Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby is just starting to explore the world around them. This Play Kit is designed to help your baby develop their senses, learn to track movement, and begin to understand cause and effect.

toys.name: Charmer Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby may start to recognize your faceâ€”cooing at you, smiling, and delighting everyone they meet. This Play Kit is designed to let your baby explore with their mouth, eyes, and hands as their personality emerges and their social awareness grows.

toys.name: Sensor Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby may be tasting, mouthing, and feeling everything they can get their hands on right now. This Play Kit helps your baby investigate their world around them, while working on getting themself closer to what looks and sounds exciting to them.

toys.name: Inspector Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby is more aware of everything around them and fascinated with details. This Play Kit makes the most of your baby's natural curiosity about how things work with opportunities to explore texture, practice nesting and stacking, and learn about object permanence.

toys.name: Explorer Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby loves to see the effect they can have on their environment. This Play Kit is designed to experiment with gravity, practice balance, and begin coordinating both sides of their body.

toys.name: Thinker Play Kit
toys.description: Your baby is starting to understand cause and effect. This Play Kit is designed to help your baby explore the concept of object permanence, practice problem-solving, and develop their fine motor skills.

toys.name: Babbler Play Kit
toys.description: Your toddler may be finding their voice and their special place in the world. This Play Kit offers new challenges in balance, object permanence, and spatial awareness, as well as an early introduction to physics.

toys.name: Adventurer Play Kit
toys.description: Your toddler is making so many discoveries about the real world at this stage. This Play Kit lets them experiment with cause and effect, use both hands at once to complete a task, and learn about a wider range of emotions
